intro: Alsodeia javanica, commonly known as the Java alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and compound leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Alsodeia javanica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
